sen.j: 重仁親王（しげひとしんのう、長久元年（1140年） - 応保2年（1162年））は、平安時代後期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Shigehito (1140 - 1162) was one of the imperial family members in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 親王の誕生前年、父である崇徳天皇は院政を行う鳥羽上皇の強い意向によって異母弟・体仁親王（後の近衛天皇）を皇太弟に立てることを強要される。
sen.e: A year earlier before the Imperial Prince was born, his father, the Emperor Sutoku was forced by the retired Emperor Toba who was executing Insei (rule by the retired emperor) to accept his half brother, Imperial Prince Narihito (future Emperor Konoe) as a younger brother of the Emperor who was heir apparent.

sen.e: Bifukumonin loved Imperial Prince Shigehito very much like her real child, and the Imperial Prince was partly believed to stay in a position closest to the next prince.

sen.e: However, after Emperor Konoe died in 1155, his father, the retired Emperor Sutoku wished the enthronement of Imperial Prince Shigehito.

sen.j: しかしながら、宮廷には崇徳上皇が藤原頼長と結んで近衛天皇を呪い殺したという噂が流れ、これに激怒した鳥羽法皇は重仁親王ではなく、上皇の弟である雅仁親王を即位させてしまう（後白河天皇）。
sen.e: Since there were rumors in the imperial court that the retired Emperor Sutoku imprecated a curse on Emperor Konoe to kill him in collaboration with FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, monk-retired Emperor Toba got so angry that he had Imperial Prince Masahito take the throne, a younger brother of the retired Emperor Sutoku (Emperor Goshirakawa), rather than Imperial Prince Shigehito.
